alert.note: Alert for Lexington; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 11 at 2:26PM EDT until June 11 at 2:45PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM EDT FOR EAST CENTRAL LEXINGTON AND CENTRAL RICHLAND COUNTIES... At 225 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Five Points, or near Forest Acres, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. This storm has a history of knocking down large trees. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. Locations impacted include... Columbia, West Columbia, Cayce, Forest Acres, Springdale, St. Andrews, Dentsville, Oak Grove, Pine Ridge, Arcadia Lakes, Villages at Sandhill, Columbia International University, Killian, Riverbanks Zoo, Woodfield, Sesquicentennial State Park, SC State Fair Grounds, West Columbia Riverwalk, Fort Jackson and Five Points. This includes the following highways... Interstate 126 between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 60 and 82. Interstate 26 between mile markers 105 and 117. Interstate 77 between mile markers 0 and 5, and between mile markers 9 and 28. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection seek shelter inside a sturdy building and stay away from windows. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways or walk through high water.
